acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale:
Its mouse LD50 values are > 16000 mg/kg (EHC) and > 40000 mg/kg (EHC).
Its rabbit LD50 value is > 5000 mg/kg (EHC).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: LD50 > NOAEL. 4-hour conversion of NOAEL (6hrs) (ATSDR) = 2.7 mg/L*6/4 = 4.05. The substance falls under between Category 4 and "Not classified" category in the JIS classification.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: LD50 > NOAEL. 4-hour conversion of NOAEL (6hrs*10 days) = 401.5*sqrt(60)/sqrt(4) = approx. 1500 ppmV. The substance falls under between Category 3 and "Not classified" category in the JIS classification.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
Its rat LD50 values are 7500 mg/kg (EHC) and 74000 mg/kg (IUCLID).
Its mouse LD50 value is > 16000 mg/kg (EHC).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale:
There is documentation on several cases of serious toxic lung diseases in humans (ACGIH).
Its kinematic viscosity is 45-125SUS (EU-Annex 1) (conversion value: 8.6-27.0 mm2/s at 37.7degC).

carcinogenicity.rationale:
In dermally administered mice, squamous-cell, papillomas and carcinomas (EHC), or hepatocellular adenoma or carcinoma (ATSDR) were observed.
The IARC lists the substance as Group 2B, and describes that marine diesel fuel is possible carcinogenic to humans.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: Due to dissociation of nitrogen and oxygen from hydrocarbon through the formation of ammonia and water, the saturation of unsaturated bonds and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain chemical groups associated with explosive properties.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Its flash point is > 54degC (EHC, ATSDR) or >= 55degC (CONCAWE, ATSDR), which is in the range between 23 and 60 degC.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In vivo mutagenicity tests using germ cells (rodent dominant lethal tests) yielded negative results (ATSDR), while in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells (mammalian bone marrow chromosome aberration tests) found positive results (ATSDR). In vivo genotoxicity tests using germ cells are not available.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Due to dissociation of oxygen from hydrocarbon through water formation during the hydrorefining process, the substance is considered as an organic compound containing no bivalent -O-O- structure.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Due to dissociation of oxygen from hydrocarbon through water formation, and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain oxygen or halogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its flash point is 254-285degC (ACGIH) or 263degC (EHC, ATSDR).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
13-week inhalation (mist) tests found no effects of the substance on weight and tissues of reproductive organs; however, there was no information on the developmental toxicity in offspring (ACGIH).
In the tests in which test animals underwent inhalation exposure (mist) between day 6 and 15 of pregnancy, the substance is reported to have only general toxicity to parental animals, and no developmental toxicity to offspring or no effects on sex ratio; however, no information available of its toxicity on sexual functions or fertility of animals that experienced exposure before becoming pregnant (ACGIH).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: There is a description that the substance is not sensitizing (EHC); however, no data are available.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Due to dissociation of nitrogen and oxygen from hydrocarbon through the formation of ammonia and water, the saturation of unsaturated bonds and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: GLP-compliant rabbit tests resulted in a Draize score of 0.0 (not irritating) (IUCLID)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: While GLP-compliant rabbit tests found that the substance is severely irritating (IUCLID) (equivalent to Category 1 or 2), rat or other rabbit tests found that it induces no response (EHC, ACGIH) (equivalent to "Not classified" category).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: There is a description that the substance is not sensitizing (EHC); however, no data are available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Due to deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale:
In dermal administration, a wide range of NOAEL has been reported: 2000 (ATSDR), 1000 (EHC), and < 250 mg/kg/day (ATSDR) for the skin; and 4000 (ATSDR), < 228 (ACGIH), and < 250 mg/kg/day (ATSDR) for the kidney.
In inhalation administration (mist), the substance was categorized into "Not classified" for all health hazards except for the kidney, nervous system, and systemic hazards (EHC, ACGIH, ATSDR).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (circulatory system, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Inhalation exposure (vapour) was associated with development of bronchitis and ventricular tachycardia (ACGIH). Oral route exposure was associated with toxic lung diseases (ACGIH).
